newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexican peso closes stronger on Cetes demand.
newsitem.headline: Mexican peso closes stronger on Cetes demand.

text.p: The Mexican peso MXAAA ended a seesaw session on the plus side Thursday as foreign investors entered Mexico to invest in the secondary money market, peso traders said.
The benchmark 48-hour peso gained 0.2 of a centavo to 7.4730/7.4770, while the 24-hour peso picked up 0.95 of a centavo to 7.4630/7.4675.
Earlier Thursday, the same-day peso closed 1.65 centavos stronger to 7.4575/7.4625.
"There were a lot of dollars offered because foreigners came in to invest in the money market," one trader said.
On the secondary money market, same-day Cetes rates bottomed out at 23 percent, 50 basis points below Wednesday's close, before returning to 24 percent.
